oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 2DV RANS-VOF NUMERICAL MODELING OF A MULTI-FUNCTIONAL HARBOUR STRUCTURE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Formentin, Sara Mizar
Palma, Giuseppina
Contestabile, Pasquale
Vicinanza, Diego
Zanuttigh, Barbara
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: multi-functional structure
breakwater
wave energy
OBREC
wave overtopping
pressures
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper is focused on the analysis of a multifunctional structure developed by the Second University of Naples, named OBREC, which is an Overtopping Breakwater for Energy Conversion. The hydraulic and structural performance are evaluated by means of the 2DV numerical model IH-2VOF developed by the University of Cantabria, in terms of average discharge rate, wave reflection coefficient and pressures acting on the structure. The results are compared with the laboratory experiments carried out at Aalborg University (Denmark) and with recent formulae and a new Artificial Neural Network. Furthermore, the numerical model is used to obtain information related to the wave loadings where experimental data were not available. This numerical analysis is a useful support to the ongoing monitoring of the prototype installation in the port of Naples.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 35 (2016): Proceedings of 35th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Antalya, Turkey, 2016; structures.3
